intro: Tanacetum pallidum, commonly known as the slender tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers appear in clusters, forming flat-topped inflorescences, and bloom from late summer to early autumn. Tanacetum pallidum is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full sun.
